Who are we?

What do you get in return?

 

Truant London is a wholly independent agency that is committed to creating a work environment that rewards its staff in a variety of ways.  On top of your day rate, some specifics include:

 

  • A minimum holidays policy, all staff must take at least 5 weeks off a year, no upper limit

What do we look for?

 

We need people who will run at things, at pace, and with good humour and positive energy.  An entrepreneurial spirit is a must, as is a desire to leave a mark.  We need someone to take responsibility for their role, and help others with theirs, to be part of something, and to help shape it further.

 

We think the following gives a good steer as to the type of business we are and the type of people we look for.

 

 

Good Truant/Bad Truant

 

Good Truants want to build something great.  Bad Truants want to be part of something already built.

 

Good Truants make things happen. Bad Truants wait for things to happen. 

 

Good Truants take responsibility when things go bad and give praise to others when things go well.  Bad Truants blame the client, the supplier, the colleague, the process.  Bad Truants look for excuses, Good Truants look to find a way through, no excuses.

 

Good Truants contribute to building agency culture and embrace a group mentality.  They want to be part of the gang, they stand up for their mates in a fight, they buy into the idea that the group is bigger than the individual. Bad Truants want to have their own gang.   Good Truants think we, not me.

 

Good Truants will understand the context of their work, whether it be strategic, creative or client service.  They will grasp the bigger picture and the collective aim.  Bad Truants will get annoyed that everything impacts them, and their job.

 

Good Truants use their time wisely, prioritizing activities and work in a way that benefits the agency.  Bad Truants spend every minute reacting to things and firefighting.

 

Good Truants anticipate when things need attention before they become a problem.  They do this by building knowledge on accounts, culture, clients, and picking up on anything that might be problematic.  Good Truants will try and bring an action plan to the table.  Bad Truants will write it off as unworkable.

 

Good Truants make the founders think twice about decisions across the business from processes and pitches to creative and strategy.  Bad Truants go along with the status quo for a quiet life and have little opinion on how things are done.

 

Good Truants do their jobs properly, promptly, passionately.  They deliver on time, they’re clear communicators, they pay close attention to the smallest of details.  They know nothing is too small to check or clarify.  Bad Truants think the small details aren’t important.

 

Good Truants find the holes in the business (there are many) and come up with strategies to fill them.  Bad Truants put up with the imperfections, at-best working around them, or at-worst using them as excuses for poor performance.

 

Good Truants will want to leave us and start their own company one day.  And we’ll support that. 

 

 

What makes us special?

 

Truant is a unique agency build upon a promise to deliver an unfair share of attention for brands, causes and ourselves.  Our advertising, media & music proposition gives us a unique set of core competencies all under one roof, working together to create work that stands out. 

 

Our collective ambition is to build a creative business unlike any other, and one that we would be happy to work with for the rest of our lives. And to guide us we’ve built a set of principles that act as the DNA to the business, those being:

 

  • We want to be respected for the work we do.
  • We want to act responsibly in all that we do.
  • We want to be a rewarding place to work.
  • We want to have a rebellious

 

 

The people we hire all share this ambition and are actively involved in making it all happen.

 

Truant isn’t perfect, it’s a ten-year-old start up.  That can be thrilling and scary all at once. It’s a place for experimenting, for tinkering, and for going against all the conventions in agency-world.

 

There would be no point creating a business that was like everyone else, so we’re committed to trying to push things forward, and we’re looking for like-minds to join us on that journey.

Customer Strategist

The role

The mission of the customer strategy function at BBH is to help brands liberate the potential of their first party data to create value for their customers, and themselves.

Despite the use of the word ‘data’ above, this is not a ‘data’ job.

Instead, the job is to turn data of all kinds into insights and stories that lead to great behaviour-driving work that helps brands grow.

That work could be a great ad, a great journey, or a great loyalty programme.

Customer Marketing is an integral part of our offering to all clients. It is not a department, it is a specialism. As a Customer Strategist, you will be a member of one of the largest, most diverse and most awarded strategy teams in London.

You will be expected to contribute to the team’s thinking on communications and effectiveness from the point of view of a customer marketer. In return, you will have the opportunity to learn from seniors and peers who are equally skilled in their disciplines, from brand advertising to social media.

You will report to a Customer Strategy Director.

The culture

At BBH, our objective is effectiveness and our strategy is creativity.

Our core belief is the power of difference to make a difference.

As such, we celebrate diversity of backgrounds and of thinking styles.

To this end, we call ourselves Black Sheep. Because you can alway count on a black sheep not to follow the herd.

The person

● Is probably between 3 and 5 years into their career.

● Is experienced in supporting a Strategy Director in the development of client presentations and is confident writing creative briefs.

● Has a knack for rapidly distilling large amounts of data of all forms into actionable insights and recommendations, with the guidance of a Strategy Director.

● Is excited to learn about all forms of communication strategy while remaining a customer strategist at heart.

 

 

● Is confident but humble, capable of defending their arguments while using others’ points of view to refine their position.

● Tells stories well, in writing, in numbers, and on charts. We do not expect star performance at this from day one, but the desire to develop this talent is essential.

● Above all, has an outstanding ability to make the complex simple. This is the essential prerequisite for success as a strategist at BBH.

Working arrangements

While we operate flexibly, this is an office-based role. We will expect this person to spend the majority of their time in our amazing Soho office.

This is for the benefit of the individual as much as our own. BBH has been called the university of advertising. More time on site means more time to learn from others.
